cs.DS, cs.DB, cs.DC, cs.OS, cs.IR. 

The paper deals with the problem of storing and processing massive small files in Hadoop Distributed File System (HDFS), which is a distributed file system used for big data processing. This suggests that the paper could belong to the Data Structures and Algorithms (cs.DS) category, which deals with the design and analysis of efficient algorithms and data structures for solving computational problems. 

The paper also proposes a new type of archive file, Hadoop Perfect File (HPF), to solve the small files problem in HDFS. This suggests that the paper could belong to the Databases (cs.DB) category, which deals with the design, implementation, and optimization of database systems. 

The paper also discusses the metadata lookup problem in existing archive files and proposes a solution that allows direct access to the metadata of a particular file without having to process the entire index file(s). This suggests that the paper could belong to the Distributed, Parallel, and Cluster Computing (cs.DC) category, which deals with the design, analysis, and implementation of distributed and parallel computing systems. 

The paper also discusses the performance of HPF compared to existing archive files and proposes experiments to evaluate its performance. This suggests that the paper could belong to the Operating Systems (cs.OS) category, which deals with the design, implementation, and evaluation of operating systems and system software.
